greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(q)^5 / f(q^5) in powers of q where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q^2)^15 * eta(q^5) * eta(q^20) / (eta(q)^5 * eta(q^4)^5 * eta(q^10)^3) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -q]^5 / QPochhammer[ -q^5], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015 *)
a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], -5 (-1)^n DivisorSum[ n, # KroneckerSymbol[ 5, #] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, -5 * (-1)^n * sumdiv(n, d, d * kronecker(5, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(-x + A)^5 / eta(-x^5 + A), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 21 2008, Mar 25 2008
